channel.title: Practitioners view on predictive modelling
channel.description: Recent content on Practitioners view on predictive modelling

item.title: Caret vs. tidymodels - comparing the old and new
item.description: In this post I will make a comparison between the most popular (by number of monthly downloads from Github) ML framework available for R to date: caret and its successor packages being written by the same author (Max Kuhn) that are wrapped together in a so called tidymodels framework. Tidymodels is a collection of different packages such as: rsample, recipes, parsnip, dials and more, that allow running an entire ML project in a tidy format end-to-end.
